page.title: 13CUMBERNAULD TRANSPORT
page.content: PEOPLE MAINLY TRAVEL IN AND OUT OF CUMBERNAULD BY BUS, CAR OR TRAIN. THE ROADS IN CUMBERNAULD ARE VERY GOOD AND MANY PEOPLE HAVE CARS. OUR LOCAL BUSES ARE QUITE GOOD THEY TAKE WORKERS TO THE INDUSTRIAL ESTATES OR PEOPLE TO THE SHOPS. THERE IS A GOOD BUS SERVICE TO TOWNS ROUND ABOUT LIKE KILSYTH, STIRLING AND GLASGOW. A BUS CAN ALSO TAKE YOU TO THE HOSPITAL AT AIRDRIE. MOST OF THE BUSES BELONG TO ALEXANDERS(MIDLAND) AND THEY ARE BLUE.IN THE SUMMER THERE ARE DAILY BUS TOURS TO BLACKPOOL, EDINBURGH AND LOTS OF OTHER PLACES. THE RAILWAY STATION IS SMALL.MOST TRAINS GO TO GLASGOW BUT YOU HAVE TO CHANGE AT SPRINGBURN. YOU CANT GET A TRAIN GOING TO EDINBUGH.OUTSIDE THE STATION YOU CAN GET A TAXI OR A LOCAL BUS TO TAKE YOU WHERE YOU WANT TO GO AFTER LEAVING THE TRAIN.
